snippet: Ali Zidan, a former diplomat under Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi and then a member of the opposition, now faces the issue of what to do about the country’s militias.
abstract: Libya's national congress narrowly  elects human rights lawyer Ali Zidan as country's interim prime minister, one week after his predecessor was dismissed for failing to present an acceptable cabinet.
lead_paragraph: Ali Zidan, a former diplomat under Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi and then a member of the opposition, now faces the issue of what to do about the country’s militias.

headline.seo: Libya’s Congress Elects Interim Prime Minister
headline.main: Libya’s Congress Elects Interim Prime Minister
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Is Chosen As Premier Of Libya
